<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY! 

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
/kind bug

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line: 
>
> /kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**:
When a pod with disk mount PVC is already moved from a node, the PVC is always be in node.volumesInUse, makes StatefulSet pod stuck in ContainerCreating forever. Although I found this issue on Azure, I think it's a common issue.

**What you expected to happen**:

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
You could find detailed steps [here](https://github.com/andyzhangx/demo/tree/master/linux/azuredisk/attach-stress-test/statefulset)
1. set up a k8s cluster with 2 agent nodes(node#1, node#2)
2. kubectl cordon node#2
3. set up 3 statefulsets (1 replica) with azure disk mount each, and all pods will be scheduled to node#1
4. kubectl uncordon node#2
5. kubectl drain node#1, and then all 3 pods will be scheduled to node#2
6. In some condition, these all 3 pods will be stuck in ContainerCreating forever

I have check status of node#1, node#2, the `node.volumesInUse` is incorrect in node#1 since all pods have been moved to node#2, `node.volumesInUse` in node#1 should be empty, while all 3 volumes are still in node#1. Actually there are also **ghost** volumes in node#1 after I `kubectl drain node#1`
```
$ kubectl get no -o yaml
node#1:
    volumesInUse:
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk//subscriptions/4be8920b-2978-43d7-ab14-04d8549c1d05/resourceGroups/andy-mg196/providers/Microsoft.Compute/disks/andy-mg196-dynamic-pvc-44047e5f-3bee-11e8-a378-000d3afe2762
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk//subscriptions/4be8920b-2978-43d7-ab14-04d8549c1d05/resourceGroups/andy-mg196/providers/Microsoft.Compute/disks/andy-mg196-dynamic-pvc-47172341-3bee-11e8-a378-000d3afe2762
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk//subscriptions/4be8920b-2978-43d7-ab14-04d8549c1d05/resourceGroups/andy-mg196/providers/Microsoft.Compute/disks/andy-mg196-dynamic-pvc-4b0456b6-3bee-11e8-a378-000d3afe2762
	...
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk/m1172705877
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk/m1501302046
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk/m1616520398
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk/m3310431730
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk/m3795987642
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk/m752008917

node#2:	
    volumesAttached:
    - devicePath: "0"
      name: kubernetes.io/azure-disk//subscriptions/4be8920b-2978-43d7-ab14-04d8549c1d05/resourceGroups/andy-mg196/providers/Microsoft.Compute/disks/andy-mg196-dynamic-pvc-47172341-3bee-11e8-a378-000d3afe2762
    - devicePath: "1"
      name: kubernetes.io/azure-disk//subscriptions/4be8920b-2978-43d7-ab14-04d8549c1d05/resourceGroups/andy-mg196/providers/Microsoft.Compute/disks/andy-mg196-dynamic-pvc-44047e5f-3bee-11e8-a378-000d3afe2762
    - devicePath: "2"
      name: kubernetes.io/azure-disk//subscriptions/4be8920b-2978-43d7-ab14-04d8549c1d05/resourceGroups/andy-mg196/providers/Microsoft.Compute/disks/andy-mg196-dynamic-pvc-4b0456b6-3bee-11e8-a378-000d3afe2762
    volumesInUse:
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk//subscriptions/4be8920b-2978-43d7-ab14-04d8549c1d05/resourceGroups/andy-mg196/providers/Microsoft.Compute/disks/andy-mg196-dynamic-pvc-44047e5f-3bee-11e8-a378-000d3afe2762
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk//subscriptions/4be8920b-2978-43d7-ab14-04d8549c1d05/resourceGroups/andy-mg196/providers/Microsoft.Compute/disks/andy-mg196-dynamic-pvc-47172341-3bee-11e8-a378-000d3afe2762
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk//subscriptions/4be8920b-2978-43d7-ab14-04d8549c1d05/resourceGroups/andy-mg196/providers/Microsoft.Compute/disks/andy-mg196-dynamic-pvc-4b0456b6-3bee-11e8-a378-000d3afe2762
    ...
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk/m1172705877
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk/m3310431730
    - kubernetes.io/azure-disk/m3795987642
```

**Anything else we need to know?**:
restart kubelet manually in both node#1, node#2 would work

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.9.6
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
